classmeta.shortdesc: Displays help about widgets in the user interface.

desc.simpara: The TipsQuery is a label which displays the tooltips of the widgets the mouse hovers. First it has to be activated with start_query: The mouse cursor changes and the label comes to life, displaying the tooltips of the hovering widget. The query is automatically deactivated when the user clicks somewhere.

With the help of the widget_entered signal, one could display a small tool tip showing the extendet data of a tooltip or call a help browser. For this purpose, the private (extendet) tooltip data could contain location of the page the help browser should display.

note.simpara: GtkTipsQuery has been deprecated since GTK+ 2.0 and should not be used in newly written code.

desc.simpara: Activates the tip query widget, so that it takes control over the mouse and displays a question cursor. The query label will show the tooltip of the widget the mouse hovers.
Before starting a query, you should call the set_caller function.
Stops a query started with the start_query function.

method.shortdesc: Sets the widget which initiates the query, usually a button.

desc.simpara: Sets the widget which initiates the query, usually a button. If the caller is selected while the query is running, the query is automatically stopped and the widget_selected is not called for this widget.
desc.note: This function has to be called before a query is started.

method.shortdesc: Sets the tooltip label for non-active states.

desc.simpara: The label_inactive is shown when the tip query widget is not in use, means not activated. It is shown the first time when the query has been used once.
The label_no_tip is shown when the tip query is active, but the widget beneath the pointer has no tooltip.

signal.shortdesc: Emitted when an active tips query enters a widget by hovering it.

desc.simpara: Emitted when an active tips query enters a widget by hovering it.

signal.shortdesc: Emitted when a widget is clicked while a tips query is active.

desc.simpara: Emitted when a widget is clicked while a tips query is active. After the click, the query is stopped.
The widget set by set_caller does not emit this signal; it stops the query immediately.
Note that the callback is called twice: When the user clicks the button, and when he releases it.
